snippet: The fate of Senate Republicans was closely watched nationally, because New York was the first state to legalize same-sex marriage with the support of a Republican-controlled legislative chamber.
abstract: Republican New York State Senators Roy J McDonald and Steven M Saland, both of whom provided pivotal votes to legalize same-sex marriage, fight opponents to a standstill in primary races so close that they will be decided only after absentee ballots are counted; Sen Mark J Grisanti, a Republican from Buffalo who also supported same-sex marriage, comfortably fends off a challenge from Kevin T Stocker.
lead_paragraph: The fate of Senate Republicans was closely watched nationally, because New York was the first state to legalize same-sex marriage with the support of a Republican-controlled legislative chamber.

headline.main: Primary Results Close for 2 G.O.P. Legislators Who Voted for Same-Sex Marriage
headline.print_headline: Primary Results Close for 2 G.O.P. Legislators Who Voted for Same-Sex Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
